contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Zamora (disambiguation){{!}}Zamora}} {{Infobox Venezuelan municipality |name= Zamora |image_skyline = |image_caption = Río Guatire in Zamora |image_map= Zamora-miranda.PNG |state= [[Miranda (state)|Miranda]] |shiretown= [[Guatire]] |area_total_km2= 378 |population_total= 189931 |population_as_of= 2007 |population_density= auto |mayor= Oswaldo Sifontes |mayor_party=[[United Socialist Party of Venezuela|PSUV]] |area_code = 0212 |website = http://zamora-miranda.gob.ve/ }} '''Zamora''' is one of the 21 [[Municipalities of Venezuela|municipalities]] ([[Municipio|municipios]]) that makes up the [[Venezuela]]n state of [[Miranda (state)|Miranda]] and, according to a 2007 population estimate by the National Institute of Statistics of Venezuela, the municipality has a population of 189,931.<ref>http://www.ine.gob.ve/sintesisestadistica/estados/miranda/cuadros/Poblacion6.xls</ref> The town of [[Guatire]] is the [[County seat|shire town]] of the Zamora Municipality.<ref name=autogenerated1>http://www.ine.gob.ve/secciones/division/Miranda.zip</ref> The municipality is one of several named "[[Zamora (disambiguation)|Zamora Municipality]]" for the 19th century Venezuelan soldier [[Ezequiel Zamora]]. ==History== The region was historically an [[agricultural]] area that cultivated various [[export]] products. The population of Guatire has increased rapidly in recent years as an east suburb of [[Caracas]]. ==Geography== The municipality's northern border, separating it from [[Vargas (state)|Vargas]], is the east part of the Costa (or Caribe) [[Mountain range|Mountain Range]], while the lower Caraballo Ridge comprises its southern border. Grande River (also called Guarenas River or Caucagua River) runs from the west to the southeast. Guatire, the municipality's shire town, is located near the western border. ==Demographics== The Zamora Municipality, according to a 2007 population estimate by the National Institute of Statistics of Venezuela, has a population of 189,931 (up from 164,726 in 2000). This amounts to 6.6% of the state's population.<ref>http://www.ine.gob.ve/sintesisestadistica/estados/miranda/cuadros/Poblacion5.xls</ref> The municipality's population density is {{convert|502.46|PD/sqkm}}.<ref>http://www.ine.gob.ve/sintesisestadistica/estados/miranda/cuadros/Poblacion4.xls</ref> ==Government== The mayor of the Zamora Municipality is Solamey Blanco Sojo, elected on October 31, 2004 with 29% of the vote.<ref>http://www.cne.gob.ve/regionales2004/13/alcaldedis=0&edo=13&mun=11&par=0&cen=0&mesa=0&cua=0.html</ref> He replaced Gerardo Rojas shortly after the elections.<ref>http://www.cne.gob.ve/estadisticas/e016.pdf</ref> The municipality is divided into two [[Parish|parishes]]; Guatire and Bolívar.<ref name=autogenerated1 /> ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://zamora-miranda.gob.ve/ zamora-miranda.gob.ve] {{es icon}} {{venezuela-stub}} {{coord|10.4667|N|66.5333|W|type:adm2nd_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Municipalities of Miranda (state)]]
